intro: Ottleya greenei, commonly known as the Greene's ottleya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Ottleya greenei has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
